definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.chinese: “喬，別打趣了，”南希沒好氣地說。

sentences.english: Impropriety is the soul of wit.
sentences.chinese: 不規矩是打趣話的精髓。

sentences.english: The smoke afraid the badinage stroker at one achievement.
sentences.chinese: 煙一下嗆住了開打趣的撫摩者。

sentences.english: He devilled her during the tour.
sentences.chinese: 他在旅行中拿她打趣逗樂。

sentences.english: The first stage, according to Yu, is what he jokingly calls "dumping".
sentences.chinese: 於冬將第一階段打趣地稱之爲“低價傾銷”。

sentences.english: He did it rarely but now he could not resist jesting with the Don.
sentences.chinese: 他很少這樣但是現在他無法抗拒和老爺子打趣的衝動。

sentences.english: Gormley jokingly hailed the protestor as "a warm-up act".
sentences.chinese: 戈姆利向他歡呼，打趣地說示威者在做“暖場演出。”

sentences.english: "Probably I'll be a vampire next, " he kiddingly said.
sentences.chinese: “也許接下去我會演個吸血鬼，”他打趣地說道。

sentences.english: His humorous rhymes were, however, more often quips and cranks at the expense of his contemporaries.
sentences.chinese: 不過，他的幽默詩句更多是對同輩人的揶揄和打趣。

sentences.english: Shi Mohan jocularly calls herself a "life illustrator".
sentences.chinese: 史墨涵打趣地自稱是一個“生活的插畫師”。

sentences.english: Old Volantis, first daughter of Valyria, the dwarf mused.
sentences.chinese: 股瓦蘭提斯，瓦雷利亞的第一個女兒，侏儒打趣。

sentences.english: Night Hua jokes white shallow, to prepare what gift, pearl?
sentences.chinese: 夜華打趣白淺，要準備什麼禮物，夜明珠嗎？

sentences.english: "It would just blow up your gas cooker, " Mercer said.
sentences.chinese: “它完全可以炸翻你的鍋爐”，默瑟打趣說。

definition: to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
to chat and laugh/to crack jokes/to banter
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
to mock oneself/to laugh at oneself
to refer to one's foibles or failings with self-deprecating humor
